definition: suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)
banner
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly
to change one's plan all of a sudden (idiom)

sentences.english: When the penny drops like this, there are only two possible outcomes.
sentences.chinese: 当年轻人幡然醒悟时，只有两种可能的后果。

sentences.english: Small later blueness and small Long Nv make eventually Shi Linfan like that repentant, determination saves a parent.
sentences.chinese: 后来小青与小龙女终于使仕林幡然悔改，决心救母。

sentences.english: Alcibiades makes his transition in specific ways in both politics and love.
sentences.chinese: 阿希比底思在政治及爱两方面，都明确地幡然改变。

sentences.english: Dad, you have just worded a profound change in my personality.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，你刚才这番话发人深思，使我幡然醒悟。

to wake up to reality/to come to oneself/to realize/to see the truth

a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)/also written 幡然[fan1 ran2]
to realize only then
suddenly/abruptly
to realize suddenly/to suddenly recall
to come to oneself with a start/to realize at a jolt
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
fully aware/to recognize fully
lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
too late to be sorry
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
